results.title: Winslow boy [study extract]
results.creator_credit: Anthony Asquith, BFI and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: The early part of the trial scenes, the cross-examinations interspersed with shots of people buying newspapers, the family coping with reporters, etc. Particularly interesting as an example of the adaptation of a stage play to the cinema. Based on the play by Terence Rattigan. Cast includes Robert Donat, Margaret Leighton.

results.title: The Wider world
results.creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker and Julian Bryan Internation Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Shows typical services performed by Girl Scouts and Girl Guides in Mexico, Burma, Finland and the United Sates. Explains how the world wide movement of Girl Scouts and Girl Guides has helped to foster understanding and friendships among girls of many countries. Includes scenes of Mexican girls, teaching illiterates to read and writes, Finnish girls taking blind on an outing; and Burmese girls caring for children in a day nursery. Written and supervised by D. A. Pennebaker.

results.title: Who knows?
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Peter Dimond and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An open-ended training session for prison officers. Deals with a number of prisoner behavioural problems. Cast includes Bill Charlton, FranklGallacher, Rob George, John Clayton, Lloyd Cunnington, Maureen Sherlock, Barbara West, Susan Wylie.

results.title: Whistle down the wind [study extract]
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Mary Hayley Bell, this extract is the story about a group of children living on a remote farm in the north of England who find a man whom the believe to be Christ. In reality he is a murderer on the run from justice. In the extract we see the children in their country environment and at their home situation. For the first time since “Christ” came to the barn, they talk with him. In the farmhouse, at tea, their father questions Kelly about talking to strange men, which she denies. After leaving the village shop with goods for the man, the three children meet a crowd of friends. The crowd eventually follows them to the farm gate and Kathy is persuaded to let them see “Jesus”.

results.title: What did you do at school today
results.creator_credit: John Power, John Morris and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Through an experience in outback camping in South Australia, a number of secondary school students learn the value of group co-operation. The decisions necessary to establish a comfortable and smooth-running campsite are made by the students themselves. Also, the shortcomings in their planning are shown - often humorously. Each student has an important part in a sequence of activities.

results.title: Weight and circuit training
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Bruce Moir, Nicholas Cockram and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 3 of Series “Conditioning for Sport”
Describes many specific exercises and training and condition techniques necessary for those interested in weight training. Weight training is a proven method for athletes to develop strength, power and muscular endurance, so it differs from weight lifting which emphasises strength and firm body building.

results.title: The Waters below
results.creator_credit: Alan Lloyd, Ray Beale and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In South Australia, the driest state in the driest continent, water, particularly underground water, is of more than seasonal importance. Questions such as - “How does the water get there? Does it maintain a certain level? Is it of a consistent quality? Who needs the water and how is it distributed, controlled and metered?” are dealt with, as well as other aspects of this essential resource, in particular how the water is used and in some cases abused.

results.title: War comes to America
results.creator_credit: Frank Capra, Anatole Litvak and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Why we fight”.
Last in a series of documentaries made to inform members of the American Armed Forces of the causes and events leading up to the United States’ entry into World War II. This program concentrates upon America’s history of liberty, equality, and justice and how it is important for the country to protect this heritage in the face of German, Italian and Japanese aggression.

results.title: Violoncello and double bass
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 2 of Series “Basic Music Techniques”
One of a series of films designed to assist the musician and the music lover. In this film professional musicians show how the violoncello and double bass are played, demonstrate their range and tone, and show how to care for them.
